opening: ^I don’t know what I was expecting. Nothing in the news is ever good these days.
^I wonder when mom is gonna be back… Things are starting to get scary out there.
^I think someone might be at the door
^Or in the house now! I should go check on that.
InteriorConvo: ^Hey [player], we wanted to stop by and hang.
^Someone decided they should let themselves in…
^Well I always love seeing you guys. Even if I do prefer letting you in myself…
after_day_choice: ^Well at least your day hasn’t been bad!
^Oh, [Player], where’s your mom? I was hoping she could make us some of her world famous cookies.
^We all know you have a crush on [player]’s mom.
^I- I… I do not! And I resent that!
^I’d like to apologize for Hunter’s behavior.
^Whoa, guys, calm down. No one needs to do any apologizing.
^But to be honest, I haven’t seen my mom for a few days.
^No, she’s just been… gone? I haven’t heard from her, either.
^You don’t need to state the obvious, dimwit.
^Yeah, we need to be focused, Hunter.
^Do you have a way you could find out where your mom is?
^Does she have GPS in her car?
^Then we can use your phone to ping it. Give me your phone [Player].
^There’s no real point in resisting Janet when she gets like this, so I hand over my phone.
^One sec, annnnnnnd we’re in. Yup, your mom’s car is… in the warehouse district? Weird.
^Does your mom go to raves in warehouses? Sick.
^No, I… I don’t know why mom would be there.

s: ^If you both think we should, why not?
^I guess I don’t have anything better to do…

investigate_confirmed: ^Awesome! We get to be like detectives.
^How is that any more silly than being detectives!
^Guys, we should really get going. It’s starting to get dark out.
^I don’t know what it is, but it feels like something bad is going to happen…
WarehouseExt1: ^The warehouse district is pretty scary, even during the day. And it’s almost nighttime.
^Kinda weird that you could recognize her car so fast.
^That’s not fair! I carpool with [Player] a lot!
^To be completely honest, their banter is keeping me from freaking out.
^Obviously. We’re going to have to go into the warehouse.
^Wait what? How do we know this is even the right one?
^I mean, all the other warehouses on the street are boarded up. This one has lights on inside.
^Come on dorks, time’s wasting. You got your magic ready, [Player]?
WarehouseInt1: ^That doesn’t matter. We need to be quick, and find anything we can about [Player]’s mom.
^Quick… okay, I can get behind that. The sooner we’re outta here the better!
^And we have to be ready to fight if we need to.
^We’re not supposed to be here. And if whoever’s running this place took your mom, they’re probably going to want to deal with us themselves.
^Is it too late to back out?
1stInt1: ^We arrive back home, weary and tired. I’ve never done anything quite like that before.
^We have to go to the police.
^Are you crazy? They’ll arrest us for breaking into that place.
^Not if we’re blowing the whistle on them. What kind of abandoned warehouse needs that kind of security?
^One that we shouldn’t get involved in anymore.
^Before we do anything, we should look at what we recovered.
^This looks like… a memo? To employees of “the Echelon Institute.” I don’t know what that means.

^There’s not a whole lot… but they’re a political organization. Think policy and such. They say they’re not affiliated with any particular group, but they’re pretty aligned with… reactionary elements.
^Lithium? What do you- No, not like that. As in, people who don’t like change. And they get really extreme about it.
^And my mom’s been taken by these people?
^I think we need to go back there.
^The police will take too long. Who knows what could happen to my mom in that time?
^Wait, Janet, you’re supposed to be the reasonable one! You’re supposed to say no to stuff like this.
^[Player] makes a convincing point- the authorities will be slower to act than us.
^Well, if you two are going to do this anyway, I guess I’m still in, too.
^Good. [Player], we’ll reconvene at the warehouse tomorrow afternoon.
^With that, my friends take their leave.
1stInt2: ^We arrive back home, weary and tired. I’ve never done anything quite like that before.
^We have to go to the police.
^Are you crazy? They’ll arrest us for breaking into that place.
^Not if we’re blowing the whistle on them. What kind of abandoned warehouse needs that kind of security?
^One that we shouldn’t get involved in anymore.
^Before we do anything, we should look at what we recovered.
^I think we found a few things… a memo, and some other shit.
^Hold it Hunter, ‘other shit?’ That ‘other shit’ could be important.
^Janet takes the papers you’ve recovered from Hunter’s hands.
^Hm, the ‘Echelon Institute.’ [Player], have you heard of them?
^Why aren’t you asking if I know them?

^There’s not a whole lot… but they’re a political organization. Think policy and such. They say they’re not affiliated with any particular group, but they’re pretty aligned with… reactionary elements.
^Lithium? What do you- No, not like that. As in, people who don’t like change. And they get really extreme about it.
^And my mom’s been taken by these people?
^Probably? Also there’s some weird mentions in the other stuff we recovered about a ‘Calcutron Construct.’
^Oh I know about that! It’s a badass robot they designed to help people do math.
^Consider me impressed Hunter. But why are they talking about it like they’re doing something more with it? Whatever, it’s not important.
^Well, I think we need to go back there.
^The police will take too long. Who knows what could happen to my mom in that time?
^Wait, Janet, you’re supposed to be the reasonable one! You’re supposed to say no to stuff like this.
^[Player] makes a convincing point- the authorities will be slower to act than us.
^Well, if you two are going to do this anyway, I guess I’m still in, too.
^Good. [Player], we’ll reconvene at the warehouse tomorrow afternoon.
^With that, my friends take their leave.
1stInt3: ^We arrive back home, weary and tired. I’ve never done anything quite like that before.
^We have to go to the police.
^Are you crazy? They’ll arrest us for breaking into that place.
^Not if we’re blowing the whistle on them. What kind of abandoned warehouse needs that kind of security?
^One that we shouldn’t get involved in anymore.
^Before we do anything, we should look at what we recovered.
^Oh boy [player], we got quite the haul. Like, so much stuff.
^Janet grabs the papers you’ve recovered from Hunter.
^Yeah, this is a very useful wealth of information.
^Well, they’re called the ‘Echelon Institute.’ Let me look them up real quick.
^Sounds kind of ominous. But also, maybe a little bit cool?
^Cool? Really? That’s your take away from all this, Hunter?

^There’s not a whole lot… but they’re a political organization. Think policy and such. They say they’re not affiliated with any particular group, but they’re pretty aligned with… reactionary elements.
^Lithium? What do you- No, not like that. As in, people who don’t like change. And they get really extreme about it.
^And my mom’s been taken by these people?
^Probably? But there’s more. There are a lot of references to this… ‘Calcutron Construct.’
^Oh I know about that! It’s a badass robot they designed to help people do math.
^Maybe that was the original intent, but there are references to it being modified. It sounds like they’ve got in a combat role or something.
^They’re big. Like, they need a lot of computing power to do math faster than magic users, so they’re extra big.
^Well, whatever the case, I think we need to go back there.
^The police will take too long. Who knows what could happen to my mom in that time?
^Wait, Janet, you’re supposed to be the reasonable one! You’re supposed to say no to stuff like this.
^[Player] makes a convincing point- the authorities will be slower to act than us.
^Well, if you two are going to do this anyway, I guess I’m still in, too.
^Good. [Player], we’ll reconvene at the warehouse tomorrow afternoon.
^With that, my friends take their leave.
WarehouseExt2: ^I drift into a fitful sleep, the events of the past day replaying themselves in my head.
^This strange and secretive organization, what are their motives? How is my mom wrapped up in all this?
^Whatever the case, when I awaken in the morning, I barely feel rested, and in the afternoon I make my way over to the warehouse.
^Hunter, you’ve been here for 10 minutes with me. If you weren’t ready, you would have said so.
2ndInt1: ^Our second evening in the warehouse was more gruelling than the last. It’s starting to take its toll on me, I think. We get home exhausted.
^Please tell me that’s the last time we’re going in there.
^I don’t know if we can rule that out just yet.
^Really? Why would we possibly need to go back there?
^For one, we don’t know where [Player]’s mom is, still.
^I can’t believe I’m the one saying this, but maybe now we go to the police.
^I don’t know if it’s safe for us to do that.
^These guys, this Echelon Institute, they seem pretty well connected. To have the firepower they do in there… they must know people in high places.
^All the more reason to call the police and trust in good old law and order.
^Wha-? [Player], that was uncalled for, right? Can you tell her that was uncalled for?

^It was completely deserved. If this Echelon Institute has the power to get those weapons in there, they certainly have the power to arrest us for breaking and entering, and assault, regardless of their wrongdoings.
^Okay, so what do we do now?
^Let’s take stock of what we found.
^I looked it over, it’s more than just a memo. This keeps coming up.
^Operation 8450. Whatever it is, it’s important to them.
^That’s right. They’re trying hard to keep this under wraps.
^Well, they say they’re spending a lot of money on ads against magic. I think I’ve even seen some of these ads; saying it’s unnatural and dangerous.
^But we can acknowledge that magic isn’t ‘normal,’ right?
^I- I can’t have this argument right now. [Player]?

s: ^Hunter, you’re out of line, but let’s move on.
^I kind of agree, Hunter, but let’s stay on track.

2ndInt2: ^Our second evening in the warehouse was more gruelling than the last. It’s starting to take its toll on me, I think. We get home exhausted.
^Please tell me that’s the last time we’re going in there.
^I don’t know if we can rule that out just yet.
^Really? Why would we possibly need to go back there?
^For one, we don’t know where [Player]’s mom is, still.
^I can’t believe I’m the one saying this, but maybe now we go to the police.
^I don’t know if it’s safe for us to do that.
^These guys, this Echelon Institute, they seem pretty well connected. To have the firepower they do in there… they must know people in high places.
^All the more reason to call the police and trust in good old law and order.
^Wha-? [Player], that was uncalled for, right? Can you tell her that was uncalled for?

^It was completely deserved. If this Echelon Institute has the power to get those weapons in there, they certainly have the power to arrest us for breaking and entering, and assault, regardless of their wrongdoings.
^Okay, so what do we do now?
^Let’s take stock of what we found.
^There are a few things in here I find concerning. First there’s this Operation 8450, which we’ve seen a few times now.
^Unpopular but important to them. And it seems to be closely linked to anti-magic efforts. And it sounds like it’s the one policy proposal they’re comfortable being public about.
^They want people to think magic is unnatural and dangerous.
^But we can acknowledge that magic isn’t ‘normal,’ right?
^I- I can’t have this argument right now. [Player]?
2ndInt3: ^Our second evening in the warehouse was more gruelling than the last. It’s starting to take its toll on me, I think. We get home exhausted.
^Please tell me that’s the last time we’re going in there.
^I don’t know if we can rule that out just yet.
^Really? Why would we possibly need to go back there?
^For one, we don’t know where [Player]’s mom is, still.
^I can’t believe I’m the one saying this, but maybe now we go to the police.
^I don’t know if it’s safe for us to do that.
^These guys, this Echelon Institute, they seem pretty well connected. To have the firepower they do in there… they must know people in high places.
^All the more reason to call the police and trust in good old law and order.
^Wha-? [Player], that was uncalled for, right? Can you tell her that was uncalled for?

^It was completely deserved. If this Echelon Institute has the power to get those weapons in there, they certainly have the power to arrest us for breaking and entering, and assault, regardless of their wrongdoings.
^Okay, so what do we do now?
^Let’s take stock of what we found.
^I think we hit the motherlode. Look at all these documents.
^Yes, there’s quite a bit to parse through in here. Mechs to suppress magic users, stripping of rights for magic users… this is some dystopian shit.
^I’m not certain, but whatever it is, it’s important.
^Yes, and closely linked to their anti-magic efforts. It sounds like this is the one aspect of their project that they think is popular.
^They’re banking on people fearing magic as unnatural and dangerous.
^But we can acknowledge that magic isn’t ‘normal,’ right?
^I- I can’t have this argument right now. [Player]?
AfterChoice: ^Anyway, there’s definitely a lot going on at the Echelon Institute that we don’t fully understand.
^I’m thinking we need to go back. Even if we don’t figure out what they’re doing, we need to find [Player]’s mom.
^We look for clues that point us in her direction. [Player]?
^Okay, we go back one more time. But that’s it. Things are getting dangerous.
^Great, we’ll meet up here at the same time tomorrow.
^Do you want to skip out on tomorrow?
^Good. Now let’s let [Player] get some rest.
^I bid Janet and Hunter good night, and they head home.
warehouseExt3: ^After yet another night of restless sleep, and a listless Sunday spent waiting for the evening, it is eventually time for me to head down to the warehouse. I meet Janet and Hunter there and wordlessly- our moods grim- we enter the warehouse for the last time.
